fields.title: Dune
fields.author: Frank Herbert
fields.blurb: Epic science-fiction saga of politics, ecology, and destiny on the desert planet Arrakis.

fields.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
fields.author: Stieg Larsson
fields.blurb: Investigative thriller where a journalist and hacker uncover a family’s dark secrets.

fields.title: The Hobbit
fields.author: J. R. R. Tolkien
fields.blurb: Bilbo Baggins is swept into a quest with dwarves, dragons, and treasure.

fields.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.blurb: A novel of childhood, justice, and conscience in the American South.

fields.title: All the Light We Cannot See
fields.author: Anthony Doerr
fields.blurb: Historical novel of a blind French girl and a German boy during WWII.

fields.title: The Big Sleep
fields.author: Raymond Chandler
fields.blurb: Hard‑boiled detective Philip Marlowe navigates blackmail and murder in Los Angeles.

fields.title: The Shining
fields.author: Stephen King
fields.blurb: A family’s winter caretaking job at an isolated hotel turns into a nightmare.

fields.title: Pride and Prejudice
fields.author: Jane Austen
fields.blurb: A classic romance of wit, manners, and miscommunication.

fields.title: Charlotte's Web
fields.author: E. B. White
fields.blurb: A tender tale of friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a spider named Charlotte.

fields.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
fields.author: Anne Frank
fields.blurb: The poignant diary of Anne Frank, written while hiding during WWII.

fields.title: A Room of One's Own
fields.author: Virginia Wolf
fields.blurb: Extended essay on women, fiction, and independence.

fields.title: The Catcher in the Rye
fields.author: J. D. Salinger
fields.blurb: Holden Caulfield’s candid account of teenage alienation in New York City.

fields.title: World‑building that sticks with you
fields.comment: Herbert makes politics, ecology, and prophecy feel inseparable. The pacing’s patient, but the payoff is massive.

fields.title: Dense but rewarding
fields.comment: I bounced off it years ago; this time it clicked. The glossary helped. Still, the first 100 pages are homeworky.

fields.title: Classic for a reason
fields.comment: Political intrigue, desert mysticism, and giant sandworms—what’s not to love?

fields.title: A perfect gateway fantasy
fields.comment: Adventure, songs, riddles, and just enough danger. Read it aloud—it's got rhythm.

fields.title: Charming and cozy
fields.comment: Less grim than LOTR and that’s the charm. Some archaic phrasing, but the heart is timeless.

fields.title: Slow burn terror
fields.comment: King weaponizes isolation. By the time the hotel ‘breathes,’ you’re done for.

fields.title: The Overlook is a character
fields.comment: Different vibe than the movie—more psychic dread, more family tragedy.

fields.title: Wit sharper than a saber
fields.comment: Austen’s social x‑rays are still relevant, and the banter is lethal in the best way.

fields.title: Romance with brains
fields.comment: Starts slow if you’re new to classics, but once Darcy thaws… chef’s kiss.

fields.title: Timeless character growth
fields.comment: Elizabeth’s self‑reflection arc is still one of the best in fiction.

fields.title: Propulsive and gritty
fields.comment: The dual timelines keep the pages turning. comment warnings apply, but it’s gripping.

fields.title: Good mystery, heavy subject matter
fields.comment: Took me a bit to warm up to Blomkvist. Salander steals every scene.

fields.title: Luminous and devastating
fields.comment: Short chapters, huge emotions. The radio scenes broke me.

fields.title: Tender amid the rubble
fields.comment: WWII fiction is crowded, but this earned its place.

fields.title: Still essential
fields.comment: Scout’s voice, Atticus’s quiet courage—every reread lands differently as I age.

fields.title: A classic with bite
fields.comment: The courtroom chapters are electric; some pacing lulls outside them.

fields.title: Peak hard‑boiled
fields.comment: Marlowe’s voice is pure noir poetry. The plot knots, but the mood carries you.

fields.title: Atmosphere for days
fields.comment: Cigarette smoke, rain, and double‑crosses—deliciously murky.
